alert.note: Alert for Dickinson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 6:45AM CDT until May 17 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Iowa... Little Sioux River near Milford affecting Dickinson County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Sioux River near Milford. * WHEN...From this morning to late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, significant amounts of pasture and other farm lands begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM CDT Sunday was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Little Sioux River Milford 12.0 13.0 Sun 5 am 13.9 12.6 11.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Monday morning at 845 AM CDT.
